details.title: COVID-19 HIGHLIGHTS | Highest single-day spike in several states; MP, UP announce house-to-house survey
details.content: A record single-day spike in COVID-19 cases was reported in several states like Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and West Bengal as the country-wide tally rose by nearly 20,000 on Sunday. (FOLLOW THE HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: Lockdown starts in Assam's Guwahati
details.content:
Assam: Streets in Guwahati wear a deserted look as 14-day complete lockdown has been imposed in entire Kamrup Metropolitan since yesterday. pic.twitter.com/UBYtY10yU9

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

details.title: Visuals from Delhi's Vijay Chowk
details.content:
Delhi: Cyclists, joggers and morning walkers exercise near Vijay Chowk. pic.twitter.com/nKwhjjEo8X

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

Disinfecting properties of chlorine is built in our fabric & is active on its surface for two weeks. On washing, chlorine is absorbed again by fabric giving it antimicrobial facility. Property available in the fabric in first wash is available even after 80 wash:Managing Director https://t.co/wUePpr67YB pic.twitter.com/gdQAcPBVXk

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

details.title: Swab robot to minimize human touch while collecting samples for COVID-19 testing
details.content:
It will take 2 minutes to collect samples. Currently, swab is collected manually. It is dangerous and can spread COVID. The robot can be operated using an app, so social distancing is maintained. It is fully automated. It can be used in hospitals & mobile vans: Karthi Velayutham https://t.co/ooL7FOqtOT pic.twitter.com/0vtLmyxMLd

— ANI (@ANI) June 28, 2020

details.title: 327 new positive cases in Assam
details.content: 327 new COVID-19 positive cases detected in Assam on Sunday. Out of these, 195 cases were reported in Guwahati city in last 24 hours. Total cases 7492, recovered 5088, active cases 2390 and deaths 11: Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma.

details.title: Latest Chhattisgarh tally
details.content: 84 new COVID-19 positive cases have been reported in Chhattisgarh on Sunday. Total number cases stand at 2964 including 619 active cases, 2062 discharges and 13 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Rajasthan further relaxes lockdown
details.content: Religious places in rural areas of the state where limited number of devotees visit are allowed to open from July 1: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Office.

details.title: 22 new cases in Jharkhand
details.content: Jharkhand reports 22 new COVID-19 positive cases and 69 recoveries today. Total number of cases stands at 2342 including 606 active cases, 1724 recoveries and 12 deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Himachal tally nears 1000
details.content: Total number of COVID-19 positive cases in Himachal Pradesh are 916 including 378 active cases, 518 recoveries and seven deaths: State Health Department.

details.title: Stats on sample testings in last 24 hours
details.content: The total number of samples tested up to 28 June is 83,98,362 of which 1,70,560 samples were tested yesterday: Indian Council of Medical Research.

details.title: West Bengal government gearing up to market immunity boosting 'sandesh'
details.content: No artificial flavours would be added to the sweetmeat which will be available in the department's outlets in the city and neighbouring districts. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: LNJP doctor, Hindu Rao Hospital staffer succumb to virus in Delhi
details.content: Sources at the Max Hospital said the doctor died in the ICU of Max Smart, a dedicated COVID-19 facility in Saket. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Malnutrition among children: The unspoken side of COVID-19 pandemic
details.content: In the first phase of lockdown amid the COVID-19 outbreak, Rinky, 30 relied on food being distributed by the Delhi government in a school near her accommodation in the capital’s Bhanwar Singh Camp. Despite the need to take care of her three-year-old daughter who is suffering from malnourishment, she could do little. The condition has not improved much since. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: 'Discriminatory': Delhi University goes for open book exams, but what does it mean for students
details.content: On Saturday, the DU postponed the OBE, which was scheduled to begin from July 1, by 10 days “in view of the prevailing situation of COVID-19 pandemic”. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: 21 more BSF staffers test positive
details.content: In the last 24 hours, 21 more Border Security Force (BSF) personnel tested positive for COVID-19 and 18 have recovered. There are 305 active cases and 655 personnel have recovered till date.

details.title: Latest coronavirus stats from Centre
details.content: 380 deaths and 19,459 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. Positive cases in India stand at 5,48,318 including 2,10,120 active cases, 3,21,723 cured/discharged/migrated & 16,475 deaths: Ministry of Health & Family Welfare.

details.title: Karnataka Minister on Bengaluru situation
details.content: Bengaluru had 1556 COVID-19 cases as on June 23 which has doubled to 3419 cases as on June 28. Bengaluru now constitutes 25.92% of total cases in Karnataka. State Government is taking all measures to ensure that every COVID patient gets best treatment: Dr Sudhakar K, Karnataka Minister.

details.content: Nagaland reports 19 new COVID-19 positive cases today, taking the total number of positive cases to 434 including 270 active cases, 164 recoveries and no deaths so far.

details.title: Telangana Home Minister Mahmood Ali tests positive for Corona
details.content: According to sources, a medical team took swabs for testing three days ago after he began showing symptoms of coronavirus infection. The result came positive on Sunday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Man who went missing from Delhi airport on his return from Kazakhstan traced to Ghaziabad, quarantined
details.content: Harjeet Singh, a resident of Dilshad Garden, arrived in Delhi on flight number AI 1916 from Almaty in Kazakhstan on Saturday and went missing from the entry gate of the screening hall at Terminal-3 of the IGI airport. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: New rules for Chardham Yatra
details.content: Uttarakhand government to begin Chardham Yatra for Uttarakhand residents only from July 1, following SOPs issued by govt in view of COVID-19. People from containment zones, quarantine centres and other states won't be allowed to take part in Yatra:Uttarakhand Chardham Devasthanam Board CEO.

details.content: Odisha detects 245 new COVID-19 positive cases in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of positive cases to 6859 including 4743 recoveries, 2086 active case and 21 deaths: State Health Department

details.title: KTU Exams postponed owing to Covid-19 situation
details.content: The varsity had received numerous representations from students and parents seeking postponement of the exams. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Delhi to get India's first 'Plasma Bank': Kejriwal
details.content:
• Delhi government has decided to start a 'Plasma Bank' in Delhi for treatment of COVID-19 patients. The 'Plasma Bank' will start operation in the next two days.
  • I appeal to COVID-19 recovered patients to donate their plasma.
  • This 'Plasma Bank' will be set-up at the Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences in Delhi.
  • Anyone who needs plasma will need a recommendation from a doctor.

details.title: Karnataka bans online classes
details.content:
For classes 1-10, Centre had laid down guidelines. Based on the guidelines and what we have done in the past, we have formed an expert committee. Once the committee submits its recommendations, we will decide the next course of action: Karnataka Education Minister https://t.co/IF9mYGDNCK

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

details.title: Plasma bank to be set up in Delhi for treatment of COVID-19 patients: Kejriwal
details.content: Addressing an online media briefing, the chief minister said the bank will start working in the next two days, adding that the AAP government will encourage those who have recovered from COVID-19 to donate their plasma. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.content:
#LIVE : Key points from Health Minister, @Eatala_Rajender press conference

details.title: Punjab CM on COVID-19 treatment facilities in state
details.content: We have got arrangements for 4,246 beds out of which 2,014 are ready, another 949 beds have been kept reserved in private sector. A total of 52 government and 195 private hospitals have been booked for COVID-19 cases. We'll have over 600 ventilators soon.

details.title: Delhi government to set up plasma bank at Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences
details.content: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday informed that within two days the 'Plasma Bank' will be started at Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences (ILBS) to help out the public. As per the procedure, all hospitals will be able to get the plasma from the storage but only after a doctor's recommendation, the doctor will request ILBS for plasma only then it will be provided for the concerned patient. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Will do antything to stop COVID-19 infection in my state: Punjab CM
details.content: If there will be any chance of the spread of COVID-19 infection in my state, I will act firmly. I will not let this disease spread in my state. I have to do my best: Captain Amarinder Singh.

details.title: Union Health Ministry on COVID-19 recovery rate in India
details.content: The gap between recoveries and active cases of COVID-19 is 1,11,602 as of today. So far, as many as 3,21,722 patients have been cured. The recovery rate is 58.67% : Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

details.content:
Maharahtra govt's launched project PLATINA, the worlds largest convalescent plasma therapy trial cum project in treatment of severe covid 19 patients today. @CMOMaharashtra has allocated Rs. 16.85 crore for this project through CM Cares Fund. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 29, 2020

details.title: Police seek curfew in Pandharpur ahead of 'Ashadhi Ekadashi'
details.content: In view of the COVID-19 outbreak, authorities have decided that 'wari' (pilgrimage) will be held this year with the padukas (foot prints) of Saint Dnyaneshwar, Sant Tukaram and others being taken to Pandharpur by air or road, and not on foot as is done traditionally.

details.title: Indian fishermen still stranded in Iran
details.content:
Sixty-three fishermen, including 44 from Tamil Nadu, are still stranded in Iran after they could not board the Indian Navy vessel INS Jalashwa at Bandar Abbas in Iran due to lack of space.

details.title: Situation under control in Madhya Pradesh: Health Minister
details.content: "We have controlled the coronavirus situation in Madhya Pradesh. Our growth rate is 78 per cent. So far, the number of active cases stands at around 2,500 whereas we are prepared with 25,000 beds," Narottam Mishra said.

details.title: Kartarpur Corridor amid COVID-19
details.content: Pakistan govt has offered to reopen Kartarpur Corridor from today. We also want that the corridor reopens but the final decision has to be taken by the Centre keeping in view COVID-19 situation: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee Chief Secretary Dr Roop Singh in Amritsar

details.title: Delhi HC extends suspension of its functioning till July 15
details.content: Delhi High Court extends the suspension of the functioning of High Court and subordinate courts till July 15, in view of the COVID19 pandemic. All pending matters listed before the Court in this period stand adjourned. Hearing in urgent matters to be held via video-conferencing.

details.title: Three judicial officers, two cops test positive for COVID-19 in Vellore
details.content: As soon as the test results were received, officials of the Vellore City Municipal Corporation sanitized the residences of the judicial officers at Sathuvachari and Rajiv Gandhi Nagar off Anna Salai

details.title: Man who returned from Rajasthan is first COVID-19 case at Vizag steel plant
details.content: The first COVID-19 case was reported at the Visakhapatnam Steel Plant (VSP) with one of its employees testing positive for the virus on Monday. The employee returned from his hometown in Rajasthan via Delhi on June 4 by a flight and was under institutional quarantine at GITAM Hospital from June 4 to 12.

details.title: Himachal Pradesh coronavirus update
details.content: Himachal Pradesh detects 3 new positive cases of #COVID19, taking the total number of positive cases in the state to 919 including 365 active cases, 534 recoveries and 7 deaths: State Health Department

details.title: COVID-19 patient from Madurai succumbs to injuries after attempting suicide
details.content: A 56-year-old COVID-19 patient, who attempted suicide by jumping from the 1st floor of a COVID care centre, succumbed to his injuries on Monday morning. The deceased was a daily wager from East Street of Palanganatham in Madurai. Sources said he was living on the first floor of a house in Palanganatham with his wife, daughter-in-law and grandson. His son is working abroad.

details.title: Odisha coronavirus update
details.content:
Odisha: People who are placed under institutional quarantine in the state are given Rs 2000 on completion of their quarantine term. A person quarantined in Jajpur says, "State govt has given all facilities here. Rs 2000 was credited in my account after I stayed here for 10 days." pic.twitter.com/zpBGBCv360

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

details.title: Madurai COVID-19 patient succumbs after attempting suicide
details.content:
The 56-year-old patient tried to kill himself by jumping from the 1st floor of a COVID care centre.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Lockdown a blunt instrument, increase restrictions in worst-hit areas alone: TN health panel
details.content: The Health Experts Committee which held a two-hour-long discussion with Chief Minister Edappadi K Palaniswami at the Secretariat on Monday did not recommend an extension of lockdown but urged the government to increase the restrictions in areas where the health indicators are not satisfactory. This is the seventh meeting the committee had with the Chief Minister since March. Dr Sowmya Swaminathan joined the meeting via video conferencing from Geneva.

details.title: 77 more Mumbai cops test positive for COVID-19
details.content: 77 police personnel found positive for COVID-19 & two others died in Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, taking the total number of active cases to 1,030 and death toll to 59 in the force: Maharashtra Police

details.title: Maharashtra Government extends lockdown in the state till 31st July
details.content:
Concerned District Collector and Commissioners of the Municipal Corporations in the state may enforce certain measures and necessary restrictions in specified local areas on the permitted non-essential activities and movement of persons to control COVID19.

All Govt offices with certain exceptions like emergency, health&medical, treasuries, disaster management, police to function with 15% strength or 15 persons whichever is higher. All private offices can operate up to 10% strength or 10 people whichever is more: Maharashtra Govt pic.twitter.com/lsN00HVWLz

— ANI (@ANI) June 29, 2020

details.title: Another BJP MLA in MP tests positive for Covid-19, third lawmaker in state to contract virus
details.content: The 36-year-old legislator, who hails from the erstwhile royal family, tested positive on Sunday night, a day after his samples were sent for testing, health department sources confirmed to The New Indian Express .

details.title: Another BJP MLA in MP tests positive for Covid-19, third lawmaker in state to contract virus
details.content: The 36-year-old legislator, who hails from the erstwhile royal family, tested positive on Sunday night, a day after his samples were sent for testing, health department sources confirmed to The New Indian Express .

details.title: Another BJP MLA in MP tests positive for Covid-19, third lawmaker in state to contract virus
details.content: The 36-year-old legislator, who hails from the erstwhile royal family, tested positive on Sunday night, a day after his samples were sent for testing, health department sources confirmed to The New Indian Express .

details.title: Steep spike in COVID-19 cases likely in July-August, warns Karnataka minister
details.content: Revenue minister R Ashoka, who has temporarily been handed change of COVID-19 management for Bengaluru, on Monday said that the state and city will see a further steep spike in cases in July-August according to the experts' committee report. While spelling out the contingency plan for Bengaluru, Ashoka admitted that not just increased testing but increased spread of infection too is causing the spike.

details.title: Plasma therapy awaits ICMR nod in Haryana
details.content:
Haryana to start Plasma Therapy for treatment of Covid-19 Patients in all its medical colleges after approval from ICMR

— ANIL VIJ MINISTER HARYANA (@anilvijminister) June 29, 2020

details.title: Social distancing goes for a toss as Congress protests fuel price hike with cycle rally in Bengaluru
details.content:
As part of its national protest against the fuel price hike, the Karnataka unit of the Congress took out a bicycle rally on Monday. Senior leaders of the party hopped on to bicycles and led hundreds of party workers in Bengaluru as they pedalled towards the party headquarters. In the process, the Congress ended up violating all social distancing norms as hundreds of party workers cycled together and crowded outside the party office before moving towards the income tax office without masks, shouting slogans and waving flags.

FULL REPORT HERE

Maharashtra Chief secretary also said that shopping and outdoor activities will be permitted in the neighborhood only with condition of mandatory wearing mask, social distancing & maintaining personal hygiene. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) June 29, 2020

details.title: 14-day ‘total lockdown’ in Guwahati from June 28
details.content: Alarmed by the spurt in the number of Covid-19 cases in Guwahati, the Assam government has enforced a 14-day “total lockdown” in the city since Sunday midnight. All government and private offices, commercial establishments, shops, industrial establishments, places of worship etc remained closed on Monday. Only pharmacies and hospitals were allowed to operate.

details.title: Over 500 cases of child marriages reported since mid-March in West Bengal
details.content: Over 500 cases of child marriage were reported in West Bengal since mid-March when the nationwide COVID-19 lockdown was imposed, officials said, claiming that in most cases, underage girls were married off by families who lost their earnings due to the shutdown.

details.title: Amid COVID-19 crisis, AP CM releases second tranche of Rs 512.35 crore to bail out MSMEs
details.content: Chief Minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on June 29, 2020, released Rs 512.35 crore in the second tranche of industrial incentives to MSMEs as part of the Rs 1,168 crore ReSTART package that includes Rs 827.5 crore incentives kept pending by the previous TDP government since 2014-15.

details.title: Incentive granted to people after completing isolation period in Odisha's quarantine centres
details.content: As per the state government's order, people coming from other states in Odisha are receiving Rs 2,000 as an incentive for completing the quarantine period. Jajpur District Magistrate Ranjan Kumar Das informed that more than 1,300 temporary quarantine centres are operational in the district. "The Government of Odisha issued an order that those coming from outside will be placed in institutional quarantine or home quarantine according to the case. To encourage people to register for (institutional) quarantine an incentive of Rs 2,000 is being given to them," Das told ANI.

details.title: COVID update from Bhubaneswar
details.content:
Private Hospitals & nursing homes in #Bhubaneswar will have to maintain a database of employees residing in slums, engage them in 14-day shifts & make accommodation arrangements for them inside hospital/nursing home premises. #Odisha @XpressOdisha @NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/zQboiUMOLk

— Hemant Kumar Rout #StayHomeStaySafe (@TheHemantRout) June 29, 2020

details.title: West Bengal government preparing app to store data on migrant labourers
details.content:
The West Bengal government is preparing a mobile app to store detailed information about migrant labourers who have returned to the state during the lockdown period, as well as their families, officials said on Monday. The labour department is collecting data on nearly 11 lakh workers who have come back from other states.

details.title: West Bengal to procure 3 crore masks
Teenager thwarts parents' plot to marry her off due to lockdown poverty
details.content:
Teenage daughter of a mason, stricken by poverty due to Covid-inducted lockdown, sought help from the local police in East Midnapore district and derailed her father’s plan to get her married off at the age of 15. The Class-X board examinee wrote a letter to the cops disclosing her parents’ intention and her aim to study further. The police intervened and got her parents to sign a written declaration that the teenager would not be married off before she turned 18. 

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: COVID-19 case found in Lucknow dist court
details.content: Lucknow District Court to remain closed for two days after detection of a COVID-19 case today. The Court will reopen after sanitization activities are undertaken.

details.title: Nagaland government extends lockdown till July 15
details.content: The Nagaland government on Monday extended the lockdown in the state till July 15 to contain the spread of the COVID-19 pandemic, a government spokesperson said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Telangana well equipped to handle COVID fight, insists health minister Eatala Rajender

details.title: West Bengal sets up 'COVID warrior club' to help contain pandemic
details.content: In a unique initiative, the West Bengal government has set up a 'COVID warrior club' in Murshidabad district, comprising people who have recovered from the disease and willing to aid the administration and health workers in containing the pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: UP attains nearly 70 per cent recovery rate in COVID-19 cases
details.content: Figuring at the fifth position among the states in the country by contributing 4 per cent to the national tally of COVID-19 patients, the recovery rate in Uttar Pradesh has notched up to nearly 70 per cent on Monday. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 positive IPS officer's wife allegedly spits on woman's face in Karnataka

details.title: Highest single-day spike of 624 COVID-19 cases in West Bengal; 14 more die
details.content: West Bengal recorded the highest single-day spike of 624 fresh COVID-19 cases on Monday, taking the state's tally to 17,907, while 14 more people succumbed to the disease raising the death toll to 653, a health bulletin said. (READ MORE)

details.title: Brazil close to coronavirus vaccine deal, says AstraZeneca
details.content: AstraZeneca director Jorge Mazzei told reporters on Monday that if the vaccine works he believes the hard-hit South American nation will get it at the end of the year. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Textile shop owner, 18 staffers test positive, Coimbatore officials say shop was closed twice for violating norms
details.content: The shop owner and the employees tested positive on Sunday. According to a revenue department official, the showroom had been closed just earlier that week, on June 24, citing violation of physical distancing rules. In the meanwhile, a senior staff of the shop with travel history tested positive for Covid-19. Despite this and in defiance of the rules, the shop owner allegedly reopened the showroom the very next day. The shop was again closed by the Coimbatore Corporation officials on June 26, officials said. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: New flu virus 'G4' discovered in China, can trigger another pandemic
details.content: The researchers then carried out various experiments including on ferrets, which are widely used in flu studies because they experience similar symptoms to humans -- principally fever, coughing and sneezing. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: PM reviews preparations for COVID-19
details.content:
• Prime Minister Narendra Modi today chaired a high-level meeting to review the preparations being undertaken for vaccination against COVID-19, as and when a vaccine is available.
  • PM directed officials to evaluate various technology tools to ensure efficient and timely vaccination in due course of time. Prime Minister also directed that detailed planning for such large scale vaccination should be undertaken immediately.
  • The current status of Indian and global vaccine development efforts was also reviewed at the meeting. Prime Minister Modi highlighted India’s responsibility and commitment to the global community to play an enabling role in global vaccination efforts against COVID-19.

details.title: ICMR to publish results of plasma therapy soon

details.title: Wear a mask, stay safe
details.content:
Prevention is better than cure, which in case of #COVID19, there's no cure too. But, we still don't seem to understand it. People continue to venture out without masks. Scenes near Chennai's Tambaram railway station.
Express photos | @ashwinacharya05.@xpresstn pic.twitter.com/X5b1CCqc3x

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) June 30, 2020

details.title: PM addresses nation ahead on Unlock 2.0
details.content:
We are entering Unlock-2.

India is in a better position than many countries of the world. Timely lockdown and other decisions have saved the lives of millions of people in India: PM

details.title: With Unlock 1, negligence has increased too: PM
details.content: Ever since Unlock-One has happened in the country, negligence in personal and social behavior is also increasing. Earlier we were very cautious about masking, taking two yards, washing hands several times a day for 20 seconds: PM

details.title: Pay more attention in containment zones: PM
details.content: The rules were followed very seriously during the lockdown. Now governments, local body entities, citizens of the country need to show the same vigilance again. In particular, we have to pay a lot of attention to Containment Jones. Those who are not following the rules, we have to interrupt and stop them: PM
PM Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana extended till November end: PM

details.title: Rs 90,000 crore allocated for expanding PM Garib Kalyan Anna Yojana
details.content: More than 80 crore poor citizens will get 5 kilo rice / wheat for these 5 months, every family will also get 1 kilo pulses too free of cost every month. The extension of the scheme will cost Rs 90,000 crore.

  •  I am extending free ration for poor till June 2021
  • Today Chief Secy has written letters to Central Home Secy regarding metro&flight services. Like international flights have been stopped till July 15 we requested restriction of domestic flights from hotspots & to start metro for people engaged in essential services.

details.title: Delhi Metro to remain closed for commuters until further notice
details.content: The Delhi Metro has been closed since March 22 when the 'Janata Curfew' was observed in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic. Subsequently, the nationwide lockdown was announced which came into effect from March 25. "Delhi Metro services will remain closed for commuters until further notice, in view of the guidelines issued by the government," a senior official said. The DMRC also tweeted to announce that services will remain closed.

details.title: Odisha chief secretary lays down guidelines for extended lockdown
details.content:
• Enforcement against wearing masks, social distancing at public places, in commercial spaces will be stronger in July in Odisha.
  • Ten districts bracketed in Zone 1 to have weekend shutdowns, dist admn authorised to restrict public transport, shops, Govt, Pvt offices and assembly.
  • The 10 dists include Ganjam, Gajapati, Khurda, Cuttack, Jajpur, Jagatsinghpur, Balasore, Mayurbhanj, Keonjhar and Jharsuguda.
  • Night curfew to be in force from 9 pm to 5 pm, earlier it was from 6 pm. Decision on opening shopping malls on local authorities.
  • Social distancing protocol not just for Govt offices, Pvt institutions will have to abide by it.

details.title: Himachal COVID tally
details.content: Number of COVID-19 cases rises to 948 in Himachal Pradesh, of which 358 cases are active. The death toll is at 8. 569 patients have recovered till date: State Health Department

details.title: Vets draw swabs of goats, sheep grazed by shepherd who tested positive for COVID-19
details.content:
Like in the case of testing humans, the expert team clad in PPEs visited the animals at Jakkanahalli near Tiptur and also others that grazed alongside them at Gollarahatti hamlet in Godekere village of Chikkanayakanahalli taluk. The samples will be sent through courier to the Animal Disease Investigation Laboratory in Bhopal in Madhya Pradesh. Until the reports arrive in 10-15 days, the sheep will be under 'quarantine'.

details.title: Kanpur homemaker accuses six family members of domestic violence, violation of COVID protocol
details.content: In a curious case of the use of the epidemic act against her in-laws, a homemaker in Kanpur lodged a police complaint against her mother-in-law, father-in-law, sister-in-law, her husband and her two children accusing all of assault, insult and criminal intimidation on Tuesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: June 30th, Telangana crosses 16,000 mark with 945 new COVID-19 cases
details.content:
#Alert : June 30th, #Telangana crosses 16k mark with 945 new #COVID cases
Reported COVID deaths 260,with 7 more deaths#TelanganaFightsCorona #TNIEupdatesOnCovid19 #MaskUpTelangana@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/q1rj5jyeCL

details.title: Positivity rate dips in UP's Gautam Buddh Nagar in random sampling
details.content: As per the officials of Gautam Buddh Nagar district administration, the low positivity rate indicated that the inflictions were high in number only in containment and densely populated areas of the district. (READ MORE)

Bengal Daily Coronavirus Update

details.title: Maharashtra COVID-19 cases up by 4,878 to over 1.74 lakh; toll 7,855
details.content: Maharashtra's coronavirus case tally rose to 1,74,761 on Tuesday with addition of 4,878 new patients while the death toll mounted by 245, including 57 fatalities in Mumbai, to 7,855. (READ MORE)

details.title: Biggest single-day spike of 652 COVID-19 cases in Bengal, tally rises to 18,559
details.content: West Bengal on Tuesday registered its highest single-day spike of 652 COVID-19 cases, which pushed the total tally in the state to 18,559, the health department said. Fifteen coronavirus patients died in the past 24 hours, taking the death toll to 668, the department said in its bulletin. Of the 15 people, 14 succumbed to comorbidities, where COVID-19 was "incidental", the bulletin said.

details.title: Gujarat's COVID-19 cases rise by 620 to 32,446; 20 more die
details.content: Gujarat on Tuesday reported 620 new COVID-19 cases, taking the overall count to 32,446 in the state, Health department said. With 20 more people succumbing to the infection, the toll has risen to 1,848, it said. A total of 422 patients were discharged in the day, taking the number of the recovered cases to 23,670.

details.title: Nine more test positive for coronavirus in Ladakh; tally stands at 973
details.content: Nine more persons tested positive for coronavirus in Ladakh, taking the total number of cases in the Union territory to 973, officials said on Tuesday. All the nine new cases were detected in Leh district, the health department officials said.

details.title: 88 fresh coronavirus cases in CRPF; total tally 1,219
details.content: Eighty-eight more Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel have tested positive for COVID-19, taking the overall infections in the country's largest paramilitary force to over 1,200, officials said on Tuesday.

details.title: 6 deaths, 150 new coronavirus cases in Punjab; total cases 5,568
details.content: Six more persons succumbed to coronavirus in Punjab on Tuesday, taking the death toll to 144 while 150 new cases pushed the state's tally to 5,568. Three fatalities were reported in Amritsar and one each in Patiala, Ludhiana and Jalandhar, according to a medical bulletin.

details.title: COVID-19 toll in J-K crosses 100-mark, 260 fresh cases recorded
details.content: The toll due to COVID-19 in Jammu and Kashmir crossed the 100-mark on Tuesday as six more patients succumbed to the disease, while the union territory's tally rose to 7,497 after 260 fresh cases were detected, officials said.

details.title: 'Unlock 2': Gujarat extends hours of ops for shops and restaurants
details.content: With 'Unlock-2' kicking in on Wednesday, the Gujarat government has extended hours of operation for shops and restaurants located in non-containment zones, guidelines for which were issued on Tuesday.

details.title: Health experts teams to do regular, surprise inspections of COVID facilities in Delhi
details.content: The three teams of medical experts constituted by the Union health ministry will conduct regular and surprise inspections at various COVID hospitals in the national capital, officials said.

details.title: Free food will be home delivered for elderly in Chennai: Tamil Nadu CM Edappadi K Palaniswami
details.content: Food, free of cost would be home delivered for the elderly, sick and destitute in Chennai and nearby areas where the intense lockdown will be in force till July 5, Chief Minister K Palaniswami said here on Tuesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Bihar MLA Anand Shankar Singh tests positive for coronavirus
details.content: Yet another member of the state legislature has tested positive in Bihar where at least three prominent politicians have been infected by coronavirus in the past fortnight, an official said here on Tuesday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Trader becomes Karur's first COVID-19 victim, found to have been treated by a quack
details.content: A 47-year-old trader from Punnam Chathiram became the first person to succumb to COVID-19 in Karur district, after initially having his fever treated by a quack. (READ MORE)

details.title: Consider sufferings of parents, institutions on fees: Madras High Court to Tamil Nadu government
details.content: The Madras High Court on Tuesday directed the Tamil Nadu government to consider the sufferings of parents and private educational institutions and formulate a scheme on collection of fees during the COVID-19 pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: Night curfew to remain in force in Himachal till further orders: CM Jairam Thakur
details.content: Addressing deputy commissioners and police officials through video conferencing from Shimla, CM Jairam Thakur said curfew would remain in force in the state from 9 pm to 5 am till further orders. (READ MORE)

details.title: Congress to air Rahul Gandhi's conversation with four nurses working on frontline to combat COVID-19
details.content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's conversation with four Indian nurses working in New Zealand, Australia, the UK and India will be aired on Wednesday during which they will share their experience of fighting the COVID-19 pandemic. (READ MORE)

details.title: Complete lockdown on five Sundays in Karnataka, marriages fixed will be allowed
details.content: Loading and unloading of cargo and travel of persons to their destinations after disembarking from buses, trains and airplanes are exempted from night curfew. (READ MORE)

details.title: Odisha announces weekend shutdown in 10 districts with high COVID-19 cases
details.content: With a surge in COVID-19 fatalities and infections in Odisha in June, the state government Tuesday announced weekend shutdown in 10 districts with high active caseloads, to prevent crowding during the easing of lockdown.

details.title: Punjab issues fresh guidelines for next phase of coronavirus lockdown
details.content: The Punjab government on Tuesday issued fresh guidelines for the next phase of the coronavirus lockdown from July 1 to 31, saying there will be no restriction on interstate and intrastate movement of persons and goods.

details.title: Railways to expand Mumbai local services from Wednesday, but only essential services personnel allowed
details.content: The Railways will expand its suburban services in Mumbai from Wednesday and run 350 trains each in the Central and Western Railway Zones, Minister Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday.

details.title: Advisory issued by West Bengal health department for COVID-19 treatment
details.content: Admitting lapses in the clinical management of COVID-19 patients in state-run as well as private hospitals in Kolkata, the state health department on Tuesday isued an advisory, including careful triaging of patients as per their symptoms.

details.title: 'Disappointed' to find officials on leave when needed, Noida DM orders no holiday sans his nod
details.content: Disappointed to find staff unavailable when needed during the COVID-19 pandemic, the Gautam Buddh Nagar administration made it mandatory for officials to go on leave only with permission of the district magistrate, according to an order issued on Tuesday.

details.title: 44 including 10 doctors test positive for COVID-19 in Dakshina Kannada
details.content: A chief medical officer of Wenlock hospital who was treating Covid-19 patients for the last two months tested positive for coronavirus and several other doctors and nurses were quarantined. Nine doctors from three private hospitals in Mangaluru too have tested positive and 60 staff from their hospitals have been quarantined. (READ MORE)
